title: Midpoint formula
text: The midpoint of the line segment whose endpoints are the two points $$(x_1,y_1)$$ and $$(x_2,y_2)$$ is $$(\frac{x_1+x_2}{2},\frac{y_1+y_2}{2})$$.
speech: The midpoint of the line segment whose endpoints are the two points  times, parentheses, x sub 1 comma y sub 1,   and , parentheses, x sub 2 comma y sub 2,   is  parentheses fraction, x sub 1 plus x sub 2, over 2,  comma, fraction, y sub 1 plus y sub 2, over 2,   .

and  , , x sub 2 comma y sub 2,

title: Plug in
text: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the $$x_2$$ and $$y_2$$ pair, and use the other as the $$x_1$$ and $$y_1$$ pair. We get $$(\frac{x_1+x_2}{2},\frac{y_1+y_2}{2})=(\frac{4+0}{2},\left(-3+\frac{\left(-5\right)}{2}\right))$$.
speech: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the  x sub 2  and  y sub 2  pair, and use the other as the  x sub 1  and  y sub 1  pair. title: Simplify
